credit_line: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
title: Project for a Coffered Ceiling, with the Muses
provenance: Leon Decloux; in his collection in 1906
medium: Pen and brown and black ink, brush and rose, gray, blue and brown washes, graphite onwhite laid paper, lined
description: The depicted part of the ceiling shows nine coffers of various shapes (rectangular at each corner, two oval, two octagonal, and one round at the center).  Each coffer includes an image of a reclining female nude on a cloud.  There is a decorative border between the coffers.
name: Drawing
